name: rngo0cl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cgr))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ RingOps, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ GrpOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c3, cgr))
-| wi(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c3 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ (c3 ∈ GrpOp → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c3, cgr))
-| wi(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c3 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ (c3 ∈ GrpOp → c1 ∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c3, cgr))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(c1st, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(c1st, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c3 ∈ GrpOp → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c3 =(1st ` c0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, crn(c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cgi, c3))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c3 ∈ GrpOp → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c2 = ran(c3)
⊣ c1 =(GId ` c3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(c1st, c0))
-| wceq(c2, crn(c3))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cgi, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c3 =(1st ` c0)
⊣ c2 = ran(c3)
⊣ c1 =(GId ` c3)

comment: A ring has an additive identity element. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 9-Sep-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
